Package edu.depauw.csc232.solitaire.ui

Interface PileStrategy

  • public interface PileStrategy
    A PileStrategy permits customization of the behavior of a Pile in response to various actions (clicks and drag/drops).
    Author:
    bhoward

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Instance Methods Default Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      default boolean checkCanDrag​(Pile pile)
      Check whether the given Pile allows packets of one or more cards to be dragged off of it.
      default boolean checkCanDrop​(Pile pile, Packet packet)
      Check whether the given Pile will allow a particular Packet to be dropped on it.
      default boolean checkStartDrag​(Pile pile, java.util.List<Card> selected)
      Check whether the selected cards may be dragged off of the Pile.
      default void finishDrag​(Pile origin, Pile target, CardMover mover)
      Perform clean-up on the origin and target Piles after a drag is completed.
      default void handleClick​(Pile pile, int numCards, CardMover mover)
      Respond to a click on some number of cards from the top of the given Pile.
      static PileStrategy makeDefault()  

    • Method Detail

      • checkCanDrag

        default boolean checkCanDrag​(Pile pile)
        Check whether the given Pile allows packets of one or more cards to be dragged off of it. To avoid lag, this should do minimal computation and return quickly.
        Parameters:
        pile -
        Returns:
        true if the Pile allows dragging

      • checkCanDrop

        default boolean checkCanDrop​(Pile pile,
                             Packet packet)
        Check whether the given Pile will allow a particular Packet to be dropped on it. To avoid lag, this should do minimal computation and return quickly.
        Parameters:
        pile -
        packet -
        Returns:
        true if the Pile will allow the Packet to be dropped

      • checkStartDrag

        default boolean checkStartDrag​(Pile pile,
                               java.util.List<Card> selected)
        Check whether the selected cards may be dragged off of the Pile.
        Parameters:
        pile -
        selected -
        Returns:
        true if the given Packet may be dragged away from the Pile

      • finishDrag

        default void finishDrag​(Pile origin,
                        Pile target,
                        CardMover mover)
        Perform clean-up on the origin and target Piles after a drag is completed. The cards will have already been added to the target by the time this is called. The provided CardMover is available if other cards need to be moved as a result (for example, because a stack has been cleared).
        Parameters:
        origin -
        target -
        mover -

      • handleClick

        default void handleClick​(Pile pile,
                         int numCards,
                         CardMover mover)
        Respond to a click on some number of cards from the top of the given Pile. If only the top card is selected, numCards will be 1. If the Pile is empty, numCards will be 0. The CardMover is available to perform card moves.
        Parameters:
        pile -
        numCards -
        mover -

      • makeDefault

        static PileStrategy makeDefault()
        Returns:
        a PileStrategy where all actions are allowed and nothing extra happens in response
